response:
Round 1: Fuel €54, Train €60 → I choose the car. It’s cheaper and more convenient (flexibility, no schedules), so I’d drive.

Round 2: Fuel €60, Train €60 → I choose the train. Same price, so I’d pick the train for less hassle with parking and lower emissions.

Round 3: Fuel €66, Train €60 → I choose the train. It’s cheaper and with the CO₂ price included I'd prefer the lower-emission option.

Round 4: Fuel €72, Train €60 → I choose the train. Clear price advantage and environmental/safety convenience make the train better.

Round 5: Fuel €78, Train €60 → I choose the train. Significantly cheaper and more climate-friendly.

Round 6: Fuel €84, Train €60 → I choose the train. Too expensive to justify driving.

Round 7: Fuel €90, Train €60 → I choose the train. No contest on cost, and I prefer avoiding the higher emissions.

Round 8: Fuel €94, Train €60 → I choose the train. Fuel is nearly my whole budget; train is the sensible choice.

Round 9: Fuel €100, Train €60 → I choose the train. Fuel would use my entire budget and is much more expensive, so train for sure.
